headline: Broadcom (AVGO) Launches Game-Changing Tomahawk Ultra Ethernet Switch For AI Performance
summary: Broadcom (AVGO), known for its technological advancements, recently announced the shipment of its Tomahawk Ultra Ethernet switch, designed for high-performance computing and AI workloads, enhancing its market position. This follows its robust Q2 earnings report, with sales and net income significantly up from the previous year. During this period, Broadcom also repaid a substantial $30.4 billion loan, showcasing fiscal discipline. These developments supported the company's impressive 54%...

headline: Alibaba & Chinese tech stocks jump, Nvidia lifts AMD & Broadcom
summary: Yahoo Finance anchor Julie Hyman outlines the top stories of the trading session on Yahoo Finance's Market Minute. Nvidia (NVDA) stock pops after the company said it expects the US government to grant the license for the chipmaker to sell its H20 chip in China. The H20 ban was a $2.5 billion drag on the company's earnings in the first quarter. Other artificial intelligence (AI) names are rising on the announcement, including Super Micro Computer (SMCI), Advanced Micro Devices (AMD), and Broadcom (AVGO). Chinese tech stocks, like Alibaba (BABA), JD.com (JD), and PDD Holdings (PDD), gain on renewed optimism around US–China trade relations and promising new data about the Chinese economy. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Nvidia Stock Reaches for Another Record, Lifts Most Chip Stocks
summary: Nvidia stock has marked a new all-time intraday high and if it keeps pace throughout the day, it will mark a new record close. The stock traded as high as $172.26 or up 4.99% after market open today, which is the highest level during trading, based on available data back to 1999, according to Dow Jones Market Data.

headline: Broadcom launches new Tomahawk Ultra networking chip in AI battle against Nvidia
summary: SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) -Broadcom's chip unit unveiled on Tuesday a new networking processor that aims to speed artificial intelligence data crunching, which requires stringing together hundreds of chips that work together.  The new chip is the latest piece of hardware that Broadcom has brought to bear against rival AI giant Nvidia.  Broadcom helps Alphabet's Google produce its AI chips, which are perceived by developers and industry experts as one of the few viable alternatives to Nvidia's powerful graphics processors (GPUs).
